I have no idea...If you go to Konan city's webpage, they have a page about =
the documents... (there is an option to view the page in english)..
=A0
htt=
p://www.city.konan.lg.jp/index.html
http://www.city.konan.lg.jp/english/rek=
ishi/index.html
=A0
=A0
=A0..that is about the best I can think of right no=
w for information on it in english. 
=A0
I know that some of those families=
 I listed earlier would tell you those stories, but again--- that is oral h=
istory and not a text...and thus, not what you are looking for.
=A0This bel=
ongs to the "non-standard" history... this idea of Hideyoshi as a spy goes =
hand-in-hand with things like the=A0intermarrying of the Southern Court wit=
h samurai from Owari... there are not many documents written on it.... let =
alone translated into english.
=A0
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 Sorry =
=3D( ... I will keep an eye and ear out though and post something if I lear=
n about an english translation.

Yea... it actually took t=
hree nights to build the original structure.. then, LATER ON, all the compl=
icated Nice-ities were added..
=A0
=A0But the actuall "battle ready fort" w=
as done in three nights.
=A0
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 In the city of Konan, there=
 is a Maeno family document which reveals alot about the Hachisuka, Maeno, =
Toyotomi, and Oda=A0Nobunaga which is not recorded in other records....
=A0=

...... might be worth looking into. Again, it contradicts some "accepted h=
istory"... so fair warning.=A0 For example, it says that Toyotomi was actua=
lly working as a spy for the Hachisuka in the beginning--- that he was not =
a peasant at all, but a low ranking samurai working as a spy. He was hired =
by the Ikoma Family and it was Ikoma's daugher that introduce Toyotomi to O=
da Nobunaga.
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 He worked with the Hachisuka and Maeno late=
r on as a combination of soldier/spy. .. in fact, many of the samurai famil=
ies from the upper Owari area (the Hachisuka, Fukushima, Kawajiri, Kumazawa=
, Nojiri, Nakagawa, Maeno=A0etc.etc) of northern Nagoya, Ichinomiya, Konan,=
 etc.etc---- most of their family history follows the "spy" version of the =
story--- not the "peasant" version..but then again, these families are know=
n to have been spies themselves-- - so I guess that it makes sense.
=A0
=A0=
So, it is worth looking into to get a very different look on it all.
